fields.headline: Blair boost for Singapore
fields.bodyText: The biggest hint yet that Tony Blair will head London's bid for the 2012 Olympic Games at the crucial July 6 meeting in Singapore was given last night. London's mayor Ken Livingstone said in a speech to promote the bid at City Hall that the prime minister would be part of the delegation. "Myself, Tony Blair, Cherie [Blair] and Tessa Jowell [culture secretary] will all be there to help London," he said. It had been feared Blair would be absent because of a G8 summit at Gleneagles.
